dialogues.text: Blue Jean baby. LA lady. Goddess to the band. Pretty eyes, pirate smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather and Bernie find a spot by the fire and she rolls joint for them.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You’1l marry a music man. Ballerina. You must have seen her dancing in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton walks through the party with a drink. People laugh talk but he is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather dances for Bernie by the fire.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: And now she’s in me. Always with me. Tiny Dancer in my hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton watches people dance, drink and make out. A bearded weirdo spins around and shouts. People sit and watch him. It’s a drugged out hippy scene.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Jesus freaks. Dance, jowl by check. Handing tickets out for God.  91 92 93 94 95 96 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone puts a tab of acid on Bernie and Heather’ tongues they kiss for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Turning back. She just laughs.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. MAMA CASS' HOUSE
dialogues.text: Elton walks onto the balcony and looks out over L.A. ligh

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Piano man. He makes his stand. In the auditorium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather takes Bernie’s hand and leads him back into the h

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Looking on. She sings his songs. The words she knows. The tunes she hums. EXT. MAMA CASS’ HOUSE - NIGHT 94 Elton looks out over the city as all the guests come out to the balcony and sing as a chorus.

dialogues.speaker: CHORUS
dialogues.text: But oh how it feels so real lying there with no one near. Only you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie and Heather find an empty bed room and enter.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON/CHORUS
dialogues.text: .»--and you can hear him. When he says softly. Slowly. Bernie whispers to her and she laughs and kisses him. Hea smiles and suddenly leaves the room. Bernie is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton looks out over L.A. Sings:  Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 55.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON/ CHORUS
dialogues.text: Hold me closer tiny dancer. Count the headlights on the highway. He sees the cars lights on Sunset Blvd below.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON/CHORUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lay me down in sheets of linen. You had a busy day today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heather returns with another girl and they undresses Bern together and they make love.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Hold me closer Tiny Dancer. You had a busy day today. 98 INT. MAMA CASS’ HOUSE. NIGHT. 98 Elton wanders in from the balcony and sits on the sofa al 99 INT. MAMA CASS’ HOUSE - NIGHT 99 Elton wakes on the sofa. His head spins and he feels hung over. A smartly dressed man, JOHN REID sits in an arm cha opposite him. He is calm and relaxed and has a knowing sm He speaks in a soft Scottish accent. He hands Elton a gla of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Dom Perignon. 63. A very good vintage.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: It’s always important to rely on the kindness of strangers. Elton looks blank.

dialogues.speaker: REID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Never mind. John Reid. He sits next to Elton.  Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 56.

dialogues.speaker: REID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know it’s all a bit overwhelming at first but something makes me think you’ll get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You're that good a judge of character are you?

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Of a great many things. In fact, I predict you could be the best selling artist in America if you desire.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: So you like the songs then?

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Not quite as much as the singer. Reid stares at Elton. Elton stares back, amazed at this u confident creature. Reid knocks back the champagne and twinkles a smile at Elton. He speaks in a low seductive t

dialogues.speaker: REID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don’t realise what happened at The Troubadour tonight, do you? There are moments in a rock stars life that define who he is and how people perceive him as he ascends into the heavens. You lit the blue touch paper and now we can all see you throwing light and colour and magic into the night sky. Where there was darkness, there is now - you. Elton John. You can do anything you want. You can be anyone you want. And it’s going to be a wild ride. Reid leans in and kisses Elton who mesmerized by this strange, dangerous and exciting creature doesn’t resist.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Fireworks? Reid smiles.  100 101 102 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naked on the bed Elton and Reid kiss. The curtain blows i the wind as the bodies in the shadows, back lit by the ne from outside the window embrace and make love. Overhead shot of Elton in bed. Elton looks over to reveal Reid next to him. Reid’s hand rests on his side as he sle Elton gently puts his hand over Reid’s, being careful not disturb him. ELton settles back, stares upwards, amazed, excited and enthralled that this has happened to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton, Reid, arrive at the club and there is a huge crowd around the block. Some asks Elton to sign his album. Ray rushes out to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Where the fuck have you been? Ray ushers them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton, Reid, and Ray walk through the club.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: A review from the L.A. Times has been syndicated. Things are going crazy. They are met by Doug at the dressing room door who reads the paper. Bernie and Heather are there too.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: “Rejoice. Rock music has a new star. He’s Elton John a 23 year old Englishman whose debut at the Troubadour was in every way magnificent.” It’s happening my friends. Reid takes the paper and reads it.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: I knew it. I fucking knew it. Bernie sees that Elton is captivated by Reid and that he looks different. Elton smiles at him.  103 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting Reid goes.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Dick's extended our stay. We’re in San Francisco tomorrow for three nights. After that we fly to NYC. Back here for two more shows. Then Dick wants us back in London to start the new album.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: This is it. You're off.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Will I see you when I get back?

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Work takes me away a lot.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: But I want to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about me. Go, enjoy your moment. That’s what’s important.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Come to London with me.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: I can’t but next time I’m there I‘1l look you up. Promise.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You're on kid. Don’t keep your public waiting.

dialogues.speaker: RIED
dialogues.text: I’m going to watch out front.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Elton! Doug points to the stage.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Give me a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton looks at the crowd through the curtain and tries take it in. Bernie joins him. 58. 103 to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green Rev. (10/29/18) White Shooting 59.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: We got to work twice as hard now, Bernie. Bernie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: We will.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: It’s never gonna last.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: So let’s enjoy it while we can. Elton smiles but actually looks closer to tears.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I’m so fucking scared. Bernie hugs his friend. Elton composes himself. We hear t crowd go wild and cheer. ‘DON’T GO BREAKING MY HEART’ starts to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on a phone ringing. Mary, the secretary, grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Dick James Publishing. Ray, hurriedly gets some papers together, obviously late. There are boxes of Fan letters on the floor and a pile of Elton’s photos on his desk waiting to be signed. The reception looks like a bomb has gone off and it’s in comp chaos.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: (To himself) Shit, shit, shit! Where is that fucking contract.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Hold on. Ray! It’s Carl from Record Mirror.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: What? Was I suppose to call him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 104 Green Rev. (10/29/18) White Shooting 59A.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. He’s asking for the release date for Elton’s new single.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Really!? I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: (into the phone) He doesn’t know.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Don’t tell him that! Did you arrange the car to take Elton to the studio?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I did’t know I had too.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Can Carl get an advance copy of the album?

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: No! Send him some tickets for the European tour or something.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Next year? He tours Canada and North America before that.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Right! Whatever! Oh balls, I’m late. Just sort it out. Another phone starts to ring. Mary answers.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Dick James Publishing (Beat) Ray, it’s Lorrain from the Mail... Ray grabs his bag and runs out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton sings with KIKI DEE. She is full of energy and they both having a great time with the song. +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.text: Green Rev. (10/29/18) White Shooting 59B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ray is in the control booth and Reid enters. He smiles at Elton and nods. Elton stops the recording and waves Reid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An excited Elton is with Reid.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Business and I promised if I was ever in town I’d look you up.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: How long are you staying?  107 White Shooting 60.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Not sure, that depends.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I can beg if you like.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: For the last six months I’ve been hearing your songs everywhere. It makes it very hard to stop thinking about you.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Really? Ray comes in.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Come on Elton, what are you doing? Either let’s go again or go to the pub.... Reid pushes Elton into a closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid gets up close and personal. The seduction is on.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: What do you want, Elton?

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Wrong answer. Reid kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Dinner with you?

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: You're so humble it’s embarrassing. You're a millionaire rock star who lives at home with his mum! This is grown up time now. Things are serious. Be brave. Think big. What do you really want!? They kiss. Reid smiles and opens the door. Bernie and Hea are there now dressed in top hat and tails and an evening gown and point at a huge theatrical curtain.  White Shooting 61. Intro: ‘HONKEY CAT’ John Reid becomes Elton’s manager and leads him on a ‘dan journey’ of discovery. Introducing him to all the finer things in life. At each stage they accumulate expensive possessions. All executed in a Hollywood 1940,/50’s Musical dance styl They enter the ballroom, and join other dancers. Reid swi Elton into a tailors dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: When I look back, boy, I must have been green. Bopping in the country, fishing in a stream. Looking for an answer, trying to find a sign Until I saw your city lights, honey, I was blind. A swarm of designers gather around him with colourful bol of cloth, sequined jackets, crazy hats. They swirl around and he eventually emerges from the colour, transformed in new attire, Reid looks on approvingly.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: They said, get back, honky cat Better get back to the woods Well, I quit those days and my redneck ways. And, oh, the change is gonna do me good. Then they dance over to a restaurant table. Waiters make fuss, setting the table, napkins, champagne and caviar served.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You better get back, honky cat Living in the city ain't where it's at. It's like trying to find gold in a silver mine. It's like trying to drink whiskey from a bottle of wine A car horn sounds and a convertible Rolls Royce pulls up. they jump in the back, back projection kicks in to reveal French Riviera mountain roads. They stop at the top of a. Staircase, as they walk / dance down the stairs , Jeweler surround them ( Like Monroe in Diamonds), they drape them watches, rings, diamond necklaces etc.  108 White Shooting 62.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, I read some books, and I read some magazines.About those high- class ladies down in New Orleans. And all the folks back home, well, said I was a fool. They said, oh, believe in the Lord is the golden rule. At the bottom of the stairs a shop window full of adverts Large Mansion houses, Reid appears with a house brochure, shows it to Elton, Reid opens his briefcase, takes out a pen and cheque book, with a flourish he writes and hands to estate agent. Elton and Reid walk off happy. An art house worker pushes a stage flat onto the stage wi collection of Francis Bacon’s, Picasso’s and Van Gogh's. Elton and Reid walk along making a selection.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON/REID
dialogues.text: They said, get back, honky cat Better get back to the woods Well, I quit those days and my redneck ways. And, oh oh oh, oh, change is gonna do me good. They said, stay at home, boy, you gotta tend the farm. Living in the city, boy, is going to break your heart. But how can you stay when your heart says no? How can you stop when your feet say go? The Artwork is rolled away to reveal a Caribbean beach, w young men and woman drinking cocktails and playing beachb Reid and Elton strip down to their bathing suits and join A Pair of plane steps appear they run up them and appear inside a beautifully furnished private plane with a piano bar in the middle. They exit the plane and find them selv In an Auction House, Furniture, sculptures are bid for, t auctioneers gavel coming down again and again and pointin ELTON, SOLD. They get up and walk through a big door into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid sits at his desk in his newly finished office. Gold disks on the walls etc. Dick James and Ray are there. It’ clear Elton has a hectic year or two ahead.  Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 63. Elton is dressed fantastically and plays pinball and drin whiskey from a tumbler. Dick looks at Elton.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: No one’s being phased out, Dick. Elton just feels that things will run more smoothly if he has personal management. Ray looks at the Francis Bacon on the wall a little confu

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Is this upside down?

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Shut up Ray! There’s never been a problem before.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: And there isn’t one now. There’s lots of work and commitments. Tours etc and that’s what I’1l be doing. Personal management. Taking care of things.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Will you really? You do realise I have a contract with Elton.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: I've already had that looked into. He’s quite within his rights to take on outside representation.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: That's what you think, you fucking poofta. Dick turns on Elton.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you're happy with this arrangement are you? After all these years.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: It’s not personal, Dick. Dick sizes Elton up then walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Come on, Ray. I own a percentage of the next two albums. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 64.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll be hearing from my lawyer you fucking rat bag. Dick and Ray go.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: That was horrible.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it’s business. Dick’s a big boy. He’ll be fine. A handsome young male P.A. BRYAN, comes in and delivers a of cocaine which Reid puts in a box on his desk. *

dialogues.speaker: BRYAN
dialogues.text: Lord Grade’s office have called about the Royal Variety performance. Apparently the Queen Mother is a big fan. I’ve booked the tickets for St. Tropez and the return flight to London the next morning.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Put us both on that and get me the number for the BBC. Bryan exits.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Couldn’t we have kept on Ray? He’s a lovely guy. Reid looks at Elton.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: ‘Lovely guy’ is not a job. This is a crucial time, Elton. You and I are going to have to be more careful. The papers have been sniffing around. We can’t give them anything to speculate on. I’m thinking of getting someone in as your girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Seems a bit excessive. *

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: No, this is your career and our business at stake. If our sleeping arrangements get out then all this is gone.  109 110 Yellow Rev. (10/24/18) White Shooting 65.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: You'll need to talk to your parents. Make sure they know what to say. Those are the first doors reporters knock on. EXT. STANLEY’S HOUSE - DAY 109 A limo stops in a drab suburban street. Elton gets out extravagantly dressed and looks completely out of place. look in amazement. He walks down the path of a down at he house. He rings the doorbell and waits. The door opens an Stanley looks at Elton in shock for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Hello, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Hello, Reg. Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton sits on a small armchair and looks around whilst Stanley sits on the sofa. It is still very awkward betwee them. More so than ever.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Looks like things have worked out well second time round.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Yes. I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Not everybody gets a second chance.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: No. Why are you here, reg?

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I wanted to show you how well I’m doing. Elton takes out a Rolex box and hands it to Stanley. Stan opens the box and looks at the watch and is dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My Music is really taking off.  Yellow Rev. (10/24/18) White Shooting 65A. Stanley turns the watch over in his hands and looks at it really is a beautiful gift. Suddenly they hear the frontd open and Stanley quickly puts the watch away. A 12 year o boy similar to the young Reggie runs in and jumps onto th sofa next to his father.

dialogues.speaker: GEOFF
dialogues.text: Dad, there’s a Rolls Royce outside! Stanley hugs Geoff whilst a second boy runs and jumps on sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yellow Rev. (10/24/18) White Shooting 66.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Geoff, Stephen. This is your brother, Reggie.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: Half-brother.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I’m not called Reggie anymore. There’s an awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought once I’m back off tour we could all get together. As a family.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Maybe. Elton looks at Stanley and the boys - it’s clear there’s real place or understanding for him here.

dialogues.speaker: GEOFF
dialogues.text: Are you really worth twenty-five million pound? Elton tries his best to smile.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I hope so.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: They’re really proud of you. We’ve even got some of your records.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: My mums say’s you’re a poofta.

dialogues.speaker: GEOFF
dialogues.text: What’s a poofta?

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: That’s enough now boys. Elton is too uncomfortable - he stands up.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I'd better be off.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Maybe you’d like to stay for tea?  Yellow Rev. (10/24/18) White Shooting 66A.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: I thought you said we could go to the chippy.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: No really, I have to get goin.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Hang on.  111 Yellow Rev. (10/24/18) White Shooting 67. Stanley leaves the room and the boys stare at Elton. No l lost here. It takes an age. Elton stands, deeply embarras by the whole thing. Stanley returns and hands Elton a pen and an album.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put ‘To Arthur’ - he’s a bloke I work with. He’s quite a big fan. Slowly Elton signs.

dialogues.speaker: GEOFF
dialogues.text: That’1l be worth a few bob now. Elton looks at his father who is still unable to express love for him.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Well, it was very nice of you to pop by, wasn’t it.

dialogues.speaker: GEOFF
dialogues.text: Let me see.

dialogues.speaker: STEPHEN
dialogues.text: He smells of lavender. Stanley holds out his hand and shakes Elton’s.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You still don’t know when yo hug me do you. Stanley looks at Elton. Elton’s right- he still can’t bri himself to show Elton any physical affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the door step Stanley holds out his hand and shakes Elton’s in a friendly manner.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: The boys loved meeting a real life pop star.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Sure. Thanks, dad. Stanley looks at Elton. He still can’t bring himself to s Elton any physical affection. +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yellow Rev. (10/24/18) White Shooting 67A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Elton as he looks at the house. The reality hars and raw. The boys with their faces pressed up against the windows look back at him. Stanley comes and gets them awa and gives a little wave. Tears start to run down Elton’s cheeks.  113 114 115 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Elton as he cries. He looks up and sees the grou all looking at him. He picks up the chair and throws it across the room at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: What’ve you got to do get a fucking drink around here?! The rest of the group and the counselor stare in shock at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton and Reid walk out through the hallway as staff clea and make things nice.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: I ask you to do one thing to protect our lives and you can’t even do that!

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You really pick your moments, don’t you? I’ve got a show. Can we do this another time.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: You're not the first closeted queer with a mummy complex.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: You've got to grow up. You’re getting worse. Do you want me to tell her?

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Why would I want that?

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Because I do everything.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: No. She’1ll make it about herself and be all distressed and dramatic. It’ll be horrible.  116 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 69. They exit driveway.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Would you rather some sleazy reporter talk to her and have her blab the wrong thing? The next day you'll be reading a headline saying ‘Elton John - Queer.’ Is that what you want? She needs to be clear on what to say. I’ve arranged for her to come over Sunday, talk to her then.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: What? You didn’t think to ask me first? Do you care how much pressure I’m under?

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Not really. the house and there are few expensive cars on the They get into a limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton and Reid are in the back of a limo. Elton drinks whiskey as Reid fumes.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: For fucks sake, stop sulking. It has to be done wether you like it or not! Are you going to be scared of her your whole life?

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Right! Stop the car!!

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Honestly, you’re pathetic. The car stops.

dialogues.speaker: REID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re on stage in 15 minutes! Elton gets out.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You're the big shot manager. You make my excuses! Tell them I’m indisposed - breaking my mothers heart.  117 118 119 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reid shouts from the window of the car as Elton legs it d the street.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Elton! Elton! INT. REGGIE’S HOUSE - DAY 118 Sheila and Fred settle down to watch the telly. ‘Liberace the Royal Albert Hall’. The phone rings. Sheila picks up.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Pinner 9755.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mum. It’s me.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: I know who you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton is half drunk, the bottle of whiskey in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I have something to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Reggie, we're going to miss the bit of the show with you on.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Look, shut up, Mum! I’m not on telly yet. I’m talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: But it’s already started and it’s live....It’s live!

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I’ve got something important to say. For Christ sake. Tell Fred to turn the TV down. Mum. Me and John we're...The thing is...I’m homosexual. A poofta. A fairy. A queen. Silence.  120 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 71.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say something.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: For godsake, I know that. I’ve known for years.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: No you haven't!

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Of course I have. You’re my child.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Right. And you don’t mind?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Frankly, I don’t care. I’d rather you keep that sort of thing to yourself. I just hope you realise you're choosing a life of being alone forever. You’ll never be loved properly. Elton hangs up as Reid opens the door of the phone box.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: She said I'll never be loved. Reid grabs Elton and gets in his face.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Don’t you ever put me in that fucking position again. You arse- hole. You’re on in 5 minutes so get over yourself and do the fucking show. We're running a business, you fat shit! Elton pushes him away.

dialogues.speaker: REID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t you push me. Reid slaps him in the face then storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton looks in the mirror at his bruised cheek. He applie some make up to cover it. He puts on an outrageous pair o glasses, then changes them for a more outrageous pair. Th he his hair - his comb is full of hairs.  121 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 72. He looks carefully where he is going bald. He sniffs a li of coke off a mirror and then puts on a outrageous head-d hat to cover his receding hairline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton come out of the dressing room. Bernie looks at him obviously unimpressed by the outlandish of his costume.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: You ok? Elton walks off down the corridor as Bernie rushes to kee up.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I’ve got the number one album in America, again! I’m about to embark on the highest grossing tour in rock history. I'm personally responsible for 5% of all record sales on the entire planet and I have the highest platform heels known to man. Of course I’m OK.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: It used to be only the two of us. Now there is bus loads of people just to do the music. Don’t you ever want to go out and sing without all this paraphernalia? You know, be yourself? As they come round the corner they both see Reid talking intimately with a young man.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Why the fuck would I want to do that? If you were a real friend you wouldn't say that shit. People don't pay to see Reg Dwight. They pay to see Elton John! Don’t ever tell me how to do my job. Reid looks at Elton. The young man laughs out of embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: You don’t have to put up with this, you know, Reg.  122 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 73.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Write the fucking lyrics, Bernie. Let me deal with the rest. Elton takes a shot of Jack Daniels from a bottle behind t stage then turn to Bernie.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: I know. Elton walks out on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton starts a wild piano with the PINBALL WIZARD riff. H screams wildly into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Ever since I was a young boy. I’ve played the silver ball. From Soho down to Brighton. I must have played them all. But I ain’t seen nothing like him. In any amusement hall. That deaf dumb and blind kid. Sure plays a mean pinball! We enter Elton ‘Pinball world’. A giant pinball machine o tours and making huge amounts of money. Reid plays Elton the ball and Elton is blindly bounced and buffered from o concert to another. From another country to another spend spree. People rush and pull him. Elton is under the glass the machine and keeps moving and being played. He goes do different holes and pops out at a new gig. Reid sings too he plays, laughs and grins away.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: He stands like a statue. Becomes part of the machine. Feeling all the bumpers. Always playing clean. He plays by intuition. The deaf dumb and blind kid. Sure plays a mean pinball!

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS AND BOYS
dialogues.text: How do you he does it? I don’t know! What makes him so good?  123 124 Yellow Rev. (10/24/18) White Shooting 74. The game gets faster and faster and more manic, Elton spi round faster and faster until Reid gives it one shove too many and Elton goes down the black hole marked L.A. We pa and see the machines TILT light flash. INT. CORRIDOR, ELTON’S HOUSE, L.A - DAY 123 Elton walks out of his room into the bright sunlight - an amazing looking transvestite maid cleans.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: MAID
dialogues.text: At your house, Mr John. In L.A. EXT. POOL AREA, ELTON’S HOUSE, L.A. - DAY 124 Elton walks out to the pool side. The ‘maid’ gives him an orange juice.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Put a couple of shots of vodka in there. He sees Reid, slightly obscured by a pool side table.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Morning. Elton sees a young man emerge and realises that Reid has a BJ from him.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You're up early.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Just a bit of ‘rock and roll’.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Rock and roll is not screwing the cleaning staff.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Rock and roll is getting you out of bed in the morning. Arranging 250 gigs a year and overseeing PRS audits in 176 different countries. It’s employment contracts for 112 people in full or part-time employment. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 75.

dialogues.speaker: REID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s insurance, copyright indemnity, renegotiating your previously insane contracts and wiping your arse. All you do is play the piano but in my case, Elton, rock and roll is a 87 million dollar a year industry and you begrudge me a little bit on the side. You really are a selfish prick.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: You're so predictable.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: This is my house. Get out of here. I want to be by myself. Not with people who don’t give a shit about me and take the fucking piss. Reid laughs at Elton. A voice calls out.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yohoo. Elton. Elton turns and sees Sheila, Fred, Ivy and a bunch of Bri who have just arrived. They are not dressed for the sun a all have suitcases and bags with them.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: What the fuck is all this?

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: You told me to hire a plane and fly your family over for the gig.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I did? Sheila joins with some other people.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: You remember the Anderson’s from next door, don’t you? Elton looks to see a middle aged couple he has no recollection of. ‘The maid’ comes and takes their bags an their eyes nearly pop out of their heads.  125 White Shooting 76.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ANDERSON
dialogues.text: Your lovely Mum’s been telling us all about the house you’ve bought her in Barnes.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. ANDERSON
dialogues.text: And what a shy little boy you were. Look at you now. Such a lovely big house. Ivy comes joins. Ivy I can’t believe I’m actually in America. I’ve never been on a plane before. She hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: How was it? Ivy I didn’t like the going up and coming down bits but the rest of it was nice. She looks around at all the people laughing and invading home and then takes Elton in. Ivy can see Elton is not at best.

dialogues.speaker: IVY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are we still going on that little trip you promised? Elton looks puzzled at Reid who nods.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Of course you are Ivy. It’s all arranged.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Come on Elton, you can show us around. Sheila takes Elton by the arm and leads him away with the Anderson's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bright lights of the city. We hear the closing music Elvis’ show.  126 White Shooting 77. INT. ELVIS’ DRESSING ROOM, LAS VEGAS CASINO - NIGHT 126 The door opens and SONNY is there with Elton and Ivy.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Elton John. Pop star from England. As he opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (To Elton) Make it quick. Members of the Memphis Mafia hang about and drink. ELVIS sat in a throne at his dressing table in his very ornate over blown dressing room. He is fat and sweaty. His breat is labored. He is doped up to the eye balls and not all there. Streaks of black hair dye run down the side of his face which an obsequious hair dresser tries in vain to fi No one takes any notice of Elton and Ivy. Close on Elton he sees the sorry state his boyhood hero is in.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: How did I sound tonight boys?

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Great boss. Really strong.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: And the back?

dialogues.speaker: MEMPHIS MAFIA
dialogues.text: Good at the back. People were crying.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: Hey Joe, find me another nice girl tonight. That one last night man, I tell ya! Best damned head I'd ever had. All the mafia boys laugh and agree with Elvis. Ivy steps forward. Ivy Elvis. It’s lovely to meet you. My grandson, Elton and I are big fans.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: That’s real nice. Thank you ma’m. I heard of your son. Everybody has. The mafia all nod but there’s an awkward silence.  127 White Shooting 78.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I was hoping you’d sing Heartbreak Hotel tonight. It was my first record.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: Another English boy come over to conquer the states and steal our money and women huh? That’s real nice. What’s your record called?

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: ‘Candle in the wind’.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: No, I think it was another one. I don’t remember.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You were a huge inspiration to me.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS
dialogues.text: ‘Were’? Elton doesn’t know what to say and Elvis sees it in his e Elvis takes a cheap nylon scarf from around his neck, dab his forehead then gives it to Ivy.

dialogues.speaker: ELVIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here you go ma’m. Glad you’all enjoyed the show. One of the Memphis Mafia starts to take off Elvis’ boots he cant reach them himself.

dialogues.speaker: SONNY
dialogues.text: Okay let’s get you out of here. The King is tired. Elton takes a last look at his hero before he exits. The crowd can be heard still screaming ‘Elvis, Elvis’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shell shocked Elton and Ivy follow Sonny. Ivy Mark my words. Dead in six months. Close on Elton ‘FUNERAL FOR A FRIEND’.  128

The front door is open and they go inside. friends, and neighbors from Pinner cavort with record com people and enjoy the thrill of being in a rock star’s hom Bernie looks into the library and sees Reid snog a young He then catches a glimpse of two or three men as they embrace. A GUY chatting up a GIRL stops Bernie.

As he sinks, pills float out of his mouth like bubb He goes further and further to the bottom as the intro to Rocketman plays. Elton reaches the bottom of the pool and curious to find a tiny figure dressed in an astronauts spacesuit who plays the introduction on a tiny toy piano. tiny figure is Young Reggie.

dialogues.text: And I’m gonna be high as a kite by then. Elton thrashes around, desperately and tries to get away Reggie, who looks up sadly. People dive in above Elton an swim down to him.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I miss the earth so much. I miss my life. It’s lonely out in space. Elton is hauled upwards by people.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)

A line of coke as they put on his stage costume. A shot of whiskey they put on his hat and glasses. Elton straightens up and now dressed in his Dodger’s Stadium attire with his bat.

The camera pans up, it is impossible to know where the lighters stop and the stars of the night sky st We pan up to the stars in the night sky. A jet flies acro the sky. Elton looks up at the plane and suddenly shoots into the air like a rocket.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Creatively speaking. I need to sort myself out.

dialogues.text: That's nice for you

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: You're stronger than me. I’m not the writer I was.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why don’t we both just disappear for a bit together. Recharge. We can go to my ranch and hide away. Write like the old days. You in one room, me in another. There’s plenty of space...

dialogues.text: No. There’s other writers I want to work with. It’ll do me good to collaborate with new people. We should take a break. 83. Bernie gets up and walks back to the bar. Elton watches h and all the others drink and party. A dark mood is over h

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello. Hello, Australia. Or New York. Or Swindon. Or where-ever-the- hell-we-are. Silence. Someone coughs.

dialogues.text: The problem with you lot, the problem with you lot is you think “Oh here comes Elton he’1ll cheer us up. He’ll sing us a song”. But you know what? It’s not that easy. Have you thought about what’s going on? (MORE )

(10/24/18) White Shooting 86.

dialogues.text: Hugh.

dialogues.text: + eH HH HH  143 Yellow Rev. (10/24/18) White Shooting 86A.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: HUGH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A paranoid and depressed Elton sits with RENATE the studi engineer at the mixing desk. There is also TWO GAY GUYS j hanging out.

dialogues.text: Would you like a cup of tea? Elton looks at Renate and she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Got anything stronger?

dialogues.speaker: RENATE
dialogues.text: Would you like to hear it again? Elton mumbles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 144 145 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 87.

dialogues.speaker: RENATE
dialogues.text: You should be very proud. I’ve watched you play many times. Your music is always so personal, honest and open. It must be hard sometimes.

dialogues.text: Elton holds a cup of tea. It is warm in his hands but he looks at it like it’s the strangest thing he’s ever seen. steam rises from the cup as Elton, Renate and the two gay guys watch a news report about Ryan White on the televisi It shows how he has AIDS from a blood transfusion and how is being vilified and persecuted at school through fear a ignorance. He is a thoughtful and decent young man as is mother who is in the news report too. Renate watches too.

dialogues.speaker: RENATE
dialogues.text: They say it’s an epidemic in New York now. I have a friend who said they call it ‘gay cancer’ at the hospital. He’s wasting away too. He has sores in his mouth and can hardly eat anymore. It’s so distressing for his family.

dialogues.speaker: GAY GUY 1
dialogues.text: My mother believes you can catch it from a toilet seat. She won’t let me use the bathroom and I caught her throwing away a cup I drank from. Elton looks at Guy 1 and notices that he is self consciou about a mark on his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: GAY GUY 2
dialogues.text: Thugs ran through the gay district in Chicago and beat people with baseball bats. INT. ELTON’S HOUSE L.A. —- MORNING 145 Elton in nothing more than a robe sits on the floor. The television is on. There is a hugh pile of records spread which he frantically goes through and alphabetizes. He st and in frustration bends and twists up and breaks a vinyl record.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Fuck!!! + eH HH a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e  Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 87A. Reid is let in by the trans maid.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you want? I’m busy.  White Shooting 88.

dialogues.text: Why don’t you get back in the studio you're paying for? Elton gets a copy of the Rolling Stone Magazine and start manically going through it and waving it at Reid.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: What’s all this about only getting to number eleven in Italy? What have you been doing?

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You never understood me or what I go through. I should have sacked you when you left me.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: You use to be a genius - now you’re just a fat fuck who plays the piano. I’m glad I left you. It means I can maintain some objectivity on your self-indulgent, myopic little world. Go in the studio and make some music, or don’t. I don’t care.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You will do when the money runs out.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: You signed contracts with me long ago. Every bit of tuna you stuff down your bloated fucking throat, every limousine you ferry your entourage around in comes out of your end. I’11 still be collecting my 20% long after you've killed yourself. Reid exits and Elton throws the ashtray at the door.  146 147 148 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton in large dark sunglasses looks sheepish and paranoi the CLINIC NURSE takes his blood. She puts a label on his sample marked ‘Mr Smith’.

dialogues.speaker: CLINIC NURSE
dialogues.text: The results take 6 to 8 weeks. We'll be in touch when we know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group all stare at Elton. His fingers are intertwined crushed.

dialogues.text: So? What were the results? *

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I got lucky. I don’t know how. I * shouldn’t be. I’ve known so many people who didn’t make it.

dialogues.speaker: COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: And how does that make you feel?

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Numb? I think I’ve gone so far from the shore that there’s no turning back.

dialogues.speaker: COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: There’s always another chance. We all make mistakes. You have to allow for that. Elton starts to laugh to himself. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slumped and lost Elton sits at the piano pressing one k Renate is in the control room. Elton look through the gla at her and a strange glow is all around her. Renate smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: him. * Elton sings a Capella: ‘DON’T LET THE SUN GO DOWN ON ME’.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I can’t light no more of my * darkness. All my pictures seem to * fade to black and white. (MORE )

dialogues.text: 149 150 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m growing tired and time stands still before me. Frozen here on the ladder of my life.

dialogues.speaker: RENATE
dialogues.text: Too late to save yourself from falling. To take a chance and change your way of life.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON/RENATE
dialogues.text: But you misread my meaning when I met you. Closed the door and left me blinded by the light. The music plays on as a gospel choir take up the song.. EXT. WOODSIDE MANSION - DAY. 90. 149 Elton and Renate stand under a flower covered alter in th gardens and kiss. There are screams and shouts and camera flashes. Elton smiles as the gospel choir sing behind the

dialogues.speaker: GOSPEL CHOIR
dialogues.text: Don’t let the sun go down on me. Although I searched myself, it’s always someone else I see. I’d just allow a fragment of your life to wander free. But losing everything is like the sun going down on me. Reid, Sheila, Fred and Ivy are there but no one is as confused and troubled as Bernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton has tears running down his face.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I’ve never said it before but Renate didn’t deserve that. She’s a good person. I dragged her into all that madness.

dialogues.text: I remember when you got married. The papers were full of it. 150  151 152 153 154 Pink Rev. (08/22/18) White Shooting 91.

dialogues.text: Did being married make you happy? *

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Not really. I’m gay.

dialogues.text: Birds sing and the sun shines as one gardener waters the and another rakes leaves.

dialogues.text: The song ends as Elton exits from one room and Renate exi from another.

dialogues.text: Morning.

dialogues.text: Elton sits at the table and pours himself a vodka and ora as Renate makes herself a coffee. She sits opposite him. clock ticks. Elton sighs.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: RENATE
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.text: A pissed Elton comes into the restaurant. The Maitre de welcomes him and Elton whispers something then makes his to a table. It’s like the King has arrived - people rubbe neck as diners greet him and shake his hand. The whole th is a complete palaver but Elton keeps a beaming smile on face then sits at the table with Sheila and Fred. Faced b his mother he is weak and child like.

dialogues.text: That poor Renate. Such a lovely * woman, divorce can be so painful. * You're looking well! *

dialogues.text: I suppose, yes. *  Pink Rev. (08/22/18) White Shooting 91A.

dialogues.text: Minorca?! What do you want to go to go there for?

dialogues.text: Because you’re driving me away.

dialogues.text: One little slip about the Jews and everyone gets hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: It wasn’t just them. You’ve insulted everybody and I’m the one who has to hear about it.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I‘ll write her a cheque, she can buy a new one!

dialogues.text: How dare you Reggie!

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I’m not fucking, Reggie! I am Elton Hercules John. Who in their right mind calls their son Reginald Dwight!?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: How could you say something like that to me when I’ve given up so much for you!?

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: What? What have you given up for me?

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: How about your father for a start!

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You heartless monster! I don’t live life in black and white. I don’t want your fucked up frigid ideas about anything. I’m sick of running away from who I am. There’s nothing wrong with success or pleasure. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (08/22/18) White Shooting 92A.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why am I apologizing for it? So I fucked everything that moves and took every drug known to man. I enjoyed every last minute of it.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: You’ve never had to work hard for a bloody thing in your life. Ever since you first dangled your legs in front of a piano you’ve been lucky. It all just comes to you and we're the ones who to suffer. I should never of had children. Do you know how disappointing it is to be your mother? + eH HH HH  155 156 Pink Rev. (08/22/18) White Shooting 93.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: What have I got to do to make you love me? What have I got to do to make you care? What do I do when lightning strikes me? And I wake to find that you're not there? Elton gets up from the table and walks through the restau to the toilets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton enters and splashes water on his face and sings int the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: What have I got to do to make you want me? What have I got to do to be heard? What do I say when it's all over? And sorry seems to be the hardest word.

dialogues.text: Elton comes out of the toilets and walks back to his tabl As he does the restaurant punters sing although they don’ look at Elton.

dialogues.text: It's sad, so sad (so sad) It's a sad, sad situation And it's getting more and more absurd. It's sad, so sad (so sad) Why can't they talk it over?

dialogues.text: Does it matter? He hates my guts.

dialogues.text: Nobody hates you, Elton. Elton pours himself a big drink and downs it.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: What are you doing here, Bernie!? You fucked off when it suited. Now you come crawling back to lecture me. From the first moment we got somewhere, you decided to leave me and go fuck some tart. Some trollop was more important to you than me and all those legends who where welcoming us in. You left me at the most important time! I went to tower records on my own, Bernie because if I’d have waited for you, it would have been too late! The waiter brings the desserts and ice cream and Elton ea

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: When did you give up, Reg? When did you stop being in control? If you don’t care about yourself how do you expect anyone else too?

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Whenever I’ve needed you most you weren’t there. I worked my balls off to get us out of the shit. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 157 158 White Shooting 95.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Day in, day out, for years. And now I’m the one who can’t walk the streets! I’m the one who doesn’t have a life. I don’t get to sit around and chew on a fucking pencil with my feet up on a desk.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: “Write the lyrics Bernie and I'1l take care of everything else”.

dialogues.text: It was a test you selfish prick! You should have known that! Elton eats and drinks more. Bernie stares at his old frie heartbroken. Elton eats and drinks more. Cue: Intro to ‘GOODBYE YELLOW BRICK ROAD’.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: When are you gonna come down. When are you going to land. I should have stayed on the farm. I should have listened to my old man. Bernie gets up and walks out of the restaurant. Elton sta to follow him.

dialogues.text: Where the fuck are you going?

dialogues.text: Bernie walks down the middle of the road. Elton follows h out.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You idiot, you idiot, you fucking idiot. What the fuck are you doing? Staff walk past but think it’s best to leave him where he

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I’1ll show them. I’1l get well. I’11 get clean and fucking show him. Bernie betrays me, everyone does. No one wants you when you lose. Ha! Fuck them. I’1l get so clean they'll fucking shit... He starts to shake. He staggers up from the desk. Shakes. is having a fit.  Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 97.

I always get him up and running. He’1ll be there. 165 INT. ELTON’S PRIVATE HOSPITAL ROOM - NIGHT 165 A nurse attends to Elton who is in bed looking grey wired to lots of machines. Elton’s eyes flicker open.

dialogues.text: How are you feeling?

dialogues.text: The heart attack after the cocaine seizure was a bit of a shock but otherwise fine.

dialogues.text: You’1ll have to talk to Dr. Vaughn about that.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: Right. Good. Reid goes and the nurse turns off the lights and leaves t The sound of “ELTON, ELTON, ELTON” fades up.

dialogues.text: These are for your blood pressure. You'll need to take 3 a day. These are Oxycodone, you need to be careful with these, it’s a pain reliever but they are very strong. Now, for the anxiety and tremors I’m going to give you Valium and Diazipam, please keep to the prescribed dose as they can cause a dependency. I’ve also booked you in with Dr. Vaughn next week to assess your irregular heartbeat. As Elton watches the TV in horror. Hugh walks up.

dialogues.text: Wow! That was quick! How you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: The heart attack after the cocaine seizure was a bit of a shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yellow Rev. (10/24/18) White Shooting 97B. Hugh smiles and shakes his head.

dialogues.text: Why doesn’t he scream and shout about the shitty hand he’s been dealt?

dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: HUGH
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just an observation.

dialogues.text: When did you get so fucking philosophical?

dialogues.speaker: HUGH
dialogues.text: I’m in Rehab. It puts a different perspective on things. You should try it.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yellow Rev. (10/24/18) White Shooting 97C.

dialogues.speaker: HUGH
dialogues.text: You heard. It’s time to stop the self pity and get on with it.

dialogues.text: I don’t need that kind of help.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You've no fucking idea what you’re talking about. Stick to being a dancer or whatever it is you do. Elton takes his big bag of prescription pills and goes.

dialogues.text: +e  166 167 168 White Shooting 98.

dialogues.text: So what do you think you'll do then? I bet that'll shoot down the Plane. It'll take me a couple of vodka and tonics to set me on my feet again. Elton gets up as he sings and walks out of the dressing r The guys all look confused.  169 170 171 White Shooting 99.

dialogues.text: Maybe you'll get a replacement There's plenty like me to be found Mongrels who ain't got a penny, sniffing for tidbits like you on the ground. Elton walks on and goes into the night leaving the hanger behind.

dialogues.text: So goodbye yellow brick road where the dogs of society howl You can't plant me in your penthouse. I'm going back to my plough. Back to the howling old owl in the woods. Hunting the horny back toad. Oh, I've finally decided my future lies. Beyond the yellow brick road. A yellow taxi pulls up besides him and Elton gets in.

dialogues.text: Hunting the horny back toad. Oh, I've finally decided my future lies. I've finally decided my future lies I've finally decided my future lies Beyond the yellow brick road

El stares at the machine. A radio plays an Elton John song. old lady gets up and turns it off. Elton sits. His hands shaky. The old lady sits next to Elton and they watch the washing spin round.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think I’m going to like it here. INT. ELTON’S ROOM, PARKLANDS HOSPITAL - DAY 179 Elton is alone. He now really suffers the effects of withdrawal. He starts to sweat and shake. He looks very i He catches sight of himself in the mirror and is horrifie

dialogues.text: Elton faces the group. A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: There was always someone better than me. Better looking. More talented. Catchier songs, whiter teeth, bigger hair. For as long as I can remember I’ve hated myself. Believed I'd never be loved.

dialogues.speaker: COUNSELOR
dialogues.text: There is a moment where we have to forgive ourselves. Elton looks serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yellow Rev. (10/24/18) White Shooting 102.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I started acting like a cunt in ‘75 and forgot to stop. I’m ashamed of myself. I’ve spent so long being resentful about things that don’t matter The group all nod in agreement and Elton smiles to himsel

dialogues.speaker: ELTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I should have tried to be more ordinary. Ivy You were never ordinary! Elton swings round and sees Ivy who is sitting amongst th group as if nothing was out of the ordinary. They smile a each other.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Look at you - in here! You really are a loser. Therapy’s a waste of time. Elton swings round in the other direction to see that it’ Sheila dressed in her 60's outfit.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You only put up with me for my money. I was nothing but a burden to you before that. Suddenly ‘Hugh’ is there.

dialogues.speaker: HUGH
dialogues.text: I didn’t realise how ready you were for all this.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I don’t know if I am to be honest but when I think of Ryan, his death...I’ve watched friends and lovers all die horribly and he did so much and I’ve done nothing. It’s time to stop the self pity and get on with it. In the reverse angle we see from behind the circle the re patients look at Elton. Now he scans the room and sees al with Ivy and Sheila are Fred, Bernie, Reid and Stanley.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: The problem is you’re selfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yellow Rev. (10/24/18) White Shooting 102A. Elton walks up to Reid.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: My ‘problem’ was I believed you loved me. I gave you everything to try and keep what I never really had.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: I always thought you were an introverted extrovert with abandonment issues.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: You what? +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yellow Rev. (10/24/18) White Shooting 103. Ivy He’s shy. He’s always been shy.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: It’s why he loves all that dressing up.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: That’s all his fathers fault.

dialogues.speaker: STANLEY
dialogues.text: Don’t blame me. He would’ve been strange regardless.

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: Oh god. Not you.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Mum. Shut up!!

dialogues.speaker: SHEILA
dialogues.text: You’re going to miss me when I’m dead.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I’m not going to allow you to talk to me like this anymore. It’s going to stop. Bernie steps forward

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: It’s about time you said that. Elton softens as he sees his true friend.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Better late than never. Sorry bernie, I never....

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: AH, AH, AH! I love you man. Always have, always will. Bernie smiles. Ray williams steps forward out of the shad and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: You know, I still cry like a baby every time I hear ‘Your song’. Can’t help it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e  Yellow Rev. (10/24/18) White Shooting 103A. Then Wilson steps up.

dialogues.speaker: WILSON
dialogues.text: I’m proud of you man. There’s a little bit of you in every song you write. Not bad for a fat kid from Pinner. Richard is there too.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Not bad for a virgin back stage kiss. Arabella too.

dialogues.speaker: ARABELLA
dialogues.text: I love telling people you where my lodgers. You still owe me six pounds in rent by the way.

dialogues.speaker: REID
dialogues.text: He doesn’t know who the hell he is.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Yes, I do! I’m Elton Hercules John! A young voice breaks through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e  181 182 White Shooting 104.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I thought you were Reggie Dwight. They all turn and stare at little Reggie who stands in th middle of the chairs. Elton walks to Reggie and kneels do The boy holds out his hand and touches Elton’s cheek, as to see that he is real.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: I haven't been Reggie Dwight for years. Behind Elton the group on chairs is made up of the real patients in therapy as they watch Elton cry. Reggie stand front of them.

dialogues.speaker: REGGIE
dialogues.text: When are you going to hug me? Slowly Elton puts his arms around the tiny figure and pul him close. INT. ELTON’S ROOM, PARKLANDS HOSPITAL - DAY 181 Elton by himself. He looks transformed. Clean, healthy, c headed. He looks in the mirror. Elton puts on a boater ha and smiles at us. He sings slowly: Intro : “I’M STILL STANDING”

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You could never know what it’s like. Your blood like winter freezes just like ice. And there’s a cold lonely light that shines from you. You’1l wind up like the wreck you hide behind that mask you use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton walks down the corridor, singing.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: And did you think this fool could never win. Well look at me, I’m coming back again. I got a taste of life in a simple way. And if you need to know why I’m still standing you just fade away.  183 184 Blue Rev. (07/31/18) White Shooting 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton walks through in to the room. The group are all the with Bernie. Everyone looks bright and happy. The beautif song picks up the tempo and a dance number breaks out.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: Don’t you know I’m still standing better than I ever did. Looking like a true survivor, feeling like a little kid. I’m still standing after all this time. Picking up the pieces of my life, my heart, my soul, my mind.

dialogues.speaker: BERNIE
dialogues.text: Once I never coulda hope to win. You started down the road leaving me no friend. The threats you made were meant to cut me down. And if love was just a circus you’d be a clown by now. Elton hugs Bernie and waves to the group and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton dances along the corridor with the group behind as sings.

dialogues.speaker: ELTON
dialogues.text: You know I’m still standing better than I ever did. Looking like a true survivor, feeling like a little kid. I’m still standing after all this time. Picking up the pieces of my life without you on my mind. He gets to large double doors, turns and smiles at us the throws the doors open. Sunlight bursts in and Elton is silhouetted in the frame. P.S. Scenes of the real E.J and the joys of his life sinc rehab.  MARV ROCKET Lata Sal) =1Aeg
